graphicslib3D.shape

Class Icosahedron

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Shape3D
      • graphicslib3D.shape.Icosahedron
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Icosahedron
extends Shape3D
    This class defines an icosahedron -- a regular closed polyhedron with 20 identical equilateral triangular faces ("icosa" is derived from the Greek word for "twenty"). The icosahedron has 12 vertices shared among the twenty triangular faces. Vertex values lie in the range -1..1, with the "top" and "bottom" vertices being [0,0,1] and [0,0,-1] respectively (in other words, the icosahedron is aligned with the Z axis).

    Invoking the draw(GLAutoDrawable) method causes vertex geometry, color, normal, and texture coordinate data to be output.

    Note: the current implementation outputs the diffuse component of the attached Material as the color, or a default 50% gray color if no Material is attached to this Shape3D, and outputs all zeros for the texture coordinates of each vertex.

    The implementation here is based on a public domain implementation by Philip Rideout.

    Warning: this class is experimental; it has not been thoroughly tested. In particular, it uses deprecated OpenGL2 calls that may not be compatible with OpenGL 3/4 or with the use of shaders in programs.

    Author:
    John Clevenger
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Draws this Icosahedron according to the current Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD and Shape3D.DRAW_MODE of the Icosahedron. If the Icosahedron has a shader attached (as evidenced by Shape3D.getShaderID() returning a non-zero value) then draw() installs the attached shader before performing any drawing operations.

        When the Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD is Shape3D.RENDER_METHOD.VBO, draw() outputs (x,y,z) position data to shader attribute position slot 0, (r,g,b,a) color data to attribute slot 1, (x,y,z) normal data to atribute slot 2, and (s,t,p,q) texture coordinate data to attribute slot 3.

        If this Shape3D has a Material assigned then the diffuse component of the Material is output as the color of each vertex; otherwise, a default 50% gray color is output.

        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        drawable - the GLAutoDrawable object on which this shape should be drawn.
